org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class IniWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.IniWriter

public class IniWriter
extends Object

The class IniWriter provides the methods to create a INI style file form a data structure that models the various sections and parameters within the sections.

Presently this class provides limited support of INI files. It does not support groups yet.

The ".ini" files have various sections each marked by the section name in square brackets. Each section name must be unique and can contain one or more properties specified as a key-value pair one per line. Each section has its own namespace, therefore two sections can have the same property name. When a property has multiple values, the values are either specified as a comma separated list, or as multiple occurences of the key in that section.

The following is a typical example of an INI style file: 

 ; a comment about the default section 
 [default] 
 logfile=myfile.log loglevel=3 
 
 ; A comment about the application section 
 [application] 
 inputfile=infile.dat 
 filter=GB,SP 
 filter=PIR

Method Detail

writeToFile

public static void writeToFile(String fileName,
                               Map iniMap)
                        throws IOException
The writeToFile method takes a hash of sections and writes the sections in the INI format style. The structure of the hash should be such that each section should have a Map associated with it which contains the parameters in the section.

Parameters:
fileName - a String value representing the file name
iniMap - a Map that contains the sections in the file
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs creating the file

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
Throws:
Exception
